content:
i have a project that has a dependency on mathlib. i dont remember having to build anything after lake exe cache get but now im on another computer and just cloned the repo (https://github.com/anandijain/is_rectangular_cuboid.lean) and ran lake exe cache get, but in vscode it still seems to be building the ~5000 files. im reading this documentation as reference: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/wiki/Using-mathlib4-as-a-dependency

any help would be great, thanks!
what was the output of lake exe cache get? The project setup looks okay to me. You could try lake exe cache get! and and see if that gives a different output

let me try it again (i think i closed the original terminal). 

PS C:\Users\anand\src\lean\is_rectangular_cuboid.lean> lake exe cache get
No files to download
Decompressing 5239 file(s)
Unpacked in 446 ms
Completed successfully!

but then i open VSCode and I see
image.png
but when I restart file, it starts the rebuild process

image.png
here is the picture of it rebuilding
awesome get! seemed to do it. thank you i didn't know about that
max has marked this topic as resolved.

I've had the same issue with mathlib for a while already, and just finally took the time to look it up here on zulip - lake exe cache get! indeed works for me, while plain lake exe cache get doesn't. Both claim to download and decompress ~5600 files though, so I don't know why one works and the other doesn't.

Actually, nevermind - I seem to have misread the terminal output earlier. lake exe cache get only downloaded roughly 800 files, while lake exe cache get! downloaded the full 5600. I'm not sure why that is, and if it is intended behaviour - but either way, I'm glad to know how to work around that issue now.
